abstract: The company is already sufficiently diversified; it delivered its sixth consecutive year of operating margins of 40 percent or more, despite the global financial crisis.
snippet: The company is already sufficiently diversified; it delivered its sixth consecutive year of operating margins of 40 percent or more, despite the global financial crisis.
lead_paragraph: BHP Billiton, the Australian mining company, has shown it doesn’t actually need to buy the Potash Corporation. BHP’s impressive annual results on Wednesday are a reminder of the financial firepower behind its $39 billion hostile bid for Potash, the world’s largest fertilizer group. But they also show that BHP is not broken — and that its chief executive, Marius Kloppers, does not need to bet a strong balance sheet on further diversification.

byline.original: By Una Galani and Christopher Swann

abstract: Grupo Santander said Wednesday that it had suspended the bank employee charged by the Securities and Exchange Commission with trading on insider information about BHP Billiton’s $39 billion bid for Potash Corp.
snippet: Grupo Santander said Wednesday that it had suspended the bank employee charged by the Securities and Exchange Commission with trading on insider information about BHP Billiton’s $39 billion bid for Potash Corp.
lead_paragraph: Grupo Santander said Wednesday that it had suspended the bank employee charged by the Securities and Exchange Commission with trading on insider information about BHP Billiton‘s $38.6 billion bid for Potash Corporation of Saskatchewan.

headline.main: Santander Suspends Analyst Charged by S.E.C.
